website_summaries.verdict: Buyers love the look of this ricer and the fact that you can store unused disks in the handle, but it can be a bit of a chore to clean.
pros: Comes in your choice of black or white
Ships with 2 different sized disks that store right on the unit
cons: A little on the large side
may not be the best option for those with smaller hands
Lot of crevasses make it difficult to clean

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ricer!
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between this one and another but this one won out by a mile. It has a couple of parts to take out for cleaning but the disassemble is very easy and makes it is super nice to a good clean. There is enough room for mulitple potatoes to push through. The little hook to use on a bowl is a neat feature if you use it. It is fairly easy to squeeze too. All and all, I love it. Used it a couple times now and still working nicely.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy ricer
customer_reviews.text: If you’re an older, small woman like me, you’re going to struggle with this ricer. It is very sturdy, though, so I expect I’ll be ricing potatoes for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lefse Anyone?
customer_reviews.text: I use primarily for a Norwegian lefse recipe where I have to rice boiled potatoes. Outstanding compared to the old style metal ricers I have used. Rices practically every last smidgen of potato or banana. Requires much less strength to press the handles than other ricers. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Gruenberg

customer_reviews.title: Washes easily. Have recommended to all my sisters
customer_reviews.text: Saves a ton of time and energy peeling potatoes. Making mashed potatoes is no longer a chore. Washes easily. Have recommended to all my sisters.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: The best potato ricer out there
customer_reviews.text: Really great ricer. Solid but not heavy, well made, easy to compress, potatoes come out perfectly sized for fluffy mashed potatoes. I should have bought this years ago, it's sI much better than the metal rivers.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: well-designed
customer_reviews.text: Learned about this ricer at sur la table. This was a present for my sister who was very impressed with it. Storage for disks on top is really useful. Potato ricing is excellent and surprisingly easy to accomplish. Only negative is locking mechanism is breakable plastic.
customer_reviews.author: kaleidoscope

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know I needed this until....
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how much I needed a potato ricer until I received this one!! I now have a potato party every night! Truly - I plan my meals around my potatoes now. Kind of pathetic but it's how I work. My only complaint lies in the "squeezing" action. My hands are sort of smallish and the handles spread apart just a tad too much to make it easy to squeeze which means I can only put a smallish amount of potatoes in the cup at a time which truly is not a big deal considering the out come. I'm going to try to "rice" some squash next. Yummy...
customer_reviews.author: MLBalfe

customer_reviews.title: Best in all categories!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than any other. No mess. Easy to use and to clean. Best potatoes river ever!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Gadreault

customer_reviews.title: Not Swiss Made
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it works well. But it is not made in Switzerland, made of course in China.
customer_reviews.author: sumerchuck

customer_reviews.title: Makes the best mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and gives mashed potatoes the perfect consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Key West girl

customer_reviews.title: No more lumpy mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.text: My mashed potatoes are no longer lumpy. Love this ricer! Also not so large to fit in my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M H Medaglia

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ricer because it was recommended by a food blog I respect. It gets the job done, but I worried while using it that I was going to snap the handles, and won't be surprised if it happens sometime in the future. I wish I'd ordered a metal one, as I'm sure it would be less flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand and haven't been disappointed with anything I've purchased from them. I will say though that it's kind of a lot larger than I expected - but that may be just me. Anyhow, it works great, the quality is great - I def expect it to last forever!
customer_reviews.author: J. Rollings

customer_reviews.title: Bought for cauliflower pizza crust, didn't do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and make cauliflower pizza crust easier. I saw a video of another lady using this exact same ricer. I know it's not what it is intended for, however, she made it seem like it would be easier. If however does not do the job the whole way. You still have to use a towel or cheese cloth. So although it might be great for potatoes pass if you going to try this for cauliflower to make the crust easier.
customer_reviews.author: BL1981

customer_reviews.title: sweet potatoes and cauliflower
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Tried with white potatoes, sweet potatoes and cauliflower. Just have to make sure you cut up into manageable pieces. And cook until the food is soft. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl F.

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I not only use it for potatoes, it makes short work of turnips, carrots, etc. I really love this thing. Don't know how I managed without one for so many years.
customer_reviews.author: Martha L. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: A terrific potato ricer
customer_reviews.text: A terrific potato ricer. My mashed potatoes have never tasted smoother since I bought this. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: gordon macrae

customer_reviews.title: got them for a friend
customer_reviews.text: since we liked ours so much, my friend will give it a try. Where we came from (Peru) we always put our potatoes throught a ricer!
customer_reviews.author: R. W

customer_reviews.title: Swiss precision
customer_reviews.text: Like this ricer. it is robust and sturdy and has two disc sizes. A bit on the heavy side but does a really good job. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Felice

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Didn't know about them until my wife said we needed one to do vegs. This one works great, even the grand kids like to use it when helping.
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than i expected. This is like magic super easy to make mashed potatoes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, large size.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It is bulky, not if you have very limited kitchen space.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Chick

customer_reviews.title: Best potato ricer ever
customer_reviews.text: The best potato ricer ever, had one and had to move from another country to the US and bought the same
customer_reviews.author: david MANFREDI

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing wrong with it: I eat mashed potatoes too often now that they are so easy to fix!
customer_reviews.author: Alberta Wilson

customer_reviews.title: unlumpy at last
customer_reviews.text: Love this gadget!! After years of remashing the potatoes once they get to the plate, I found a device that does away with the problem. And it's dishwasher safe. What more could one ask for?
customer_reviews.author: betsy stierly

customer_reviews.title: The first Ricer I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I love this Ricer and I am using it for mashing root veggies and winter squash no lumps great texture.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Rowlands

customer_reviews.title: I love this potato ricer!
customer_reviews.text: The Rikon Potato Ricer helps me make creamier mashed potatoes than before. It's very simple to use and clean up is a breeze. I like that the extra blade is self contained.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awkward size ricer
customer_reviews.text: my new ricer works very well. it is kind of big and awkward to use but it does rice the potatoes nicely. jane
customer_reviews.author: K.Borg

customer_reviews.title: No more lost discs!
customer_reviews.text: This ricer appears well made. The built in storage for the spare disc is a huge benefit. Makes great riced potatoes, but my primary use is for hash browns. I use the ricer to squeeze the moisture from shredded raw potatoes. Do not try to squeeze raw potatoes thru the discs - just get the liquid out. Much more effective than paper towel blotting. Easy to clean up too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Durbin

customer_reviews.title: The Best Tool for Great Mash
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I have ever used for mash potato -it makes the mash light and fluffy. The ricer is easy to use andeasy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Potato Ricers I have ever used. My second one (I have one in another home overseas) and kept looking for it here in the US. Easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Orabi

customer_reviews.title: NOT PRACTICAL AT ALL! To hard to use!
customer_reviews.text: Cool design and well-made but I've only used it once because it's REALLY HARD TO USE - IT TAKES A LOT OF EFFORT to press both handles down/together. I had two men try it and they had a difficult time using it too. My hand, wrist and arm hurt for a couple of days after using it. It takes too long to mash a small amount of food.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthnamaste

customer_reviews.title: Item received promptly.
customer_reviews.text: The item was delivered prompty. I cannot say if the item is OK as it has noy been opened yet. It is a Xmas present for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Naylor

customer_reviews.title: One huge honker!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I'd like it. This sucker is huge! It has so much torque that I have to be careful and not squeeze too hard. The first time I used it I shot potatoes across the room and on the wall! And I'm an old woman, we don't do things like that anymore. It's nice, I like the built in blade storage and it works well and rices potatoes with ease. It's a lot easier than using your grandma's potato masher that's for sure. It's fast and it's easy. Get your mom one, she's gonna thank you once she uses it.
customer_reviews.author: SurrealChereal

customer_reviews.title: Keto Diet Cauliflower Strainer
customer_reviews.text: Use to make pizza crust for Keto diet. Excellent product to remove water from cauliflower. Works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: HarleyRiderForLife

customer_reviews.title: This is the secret to Fluffy Mashed Potatoes everyone will love,
customer_reviews.text: this a great ricer, it has 2 different screens for a coarser potato and a smaller one for fluffy. My family loves my fluffy potatoes, especially during the holidays. Only drawback is it needs to be hand washed because of its size and the fact that screens don't come clean. Always some potato left behind. Immediately after using I remove most potato with a spatula and then wash, so much easier when food doesn't dry on device. Will try to use the coarse screen for sweet potatoes this week.
customer_reviews.author: lovemyshoes!

customer_reviews.title: I use this to squeeze the water out of cauliflower ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to squeeze the water out of cauliflower when making cauliflower pizza crust. Just what I was looking for!!!!
customer_reviews.author: lf4JC

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a ricer forEVer, and finally ordered. I didn't think I'd like the plastic, but it's got great reviews, so I thought I'd give it a try. I'm very happy with the quality and performance of this item. It comes with 2 different ricer discs, the one you're not using stores right in the unit. It's easy to use, cleans easily, and won't rust like my old one did.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia LeVieux

customer_reviews.title: works perfect
customer_reviews.text: very well made and if you cook the potatoes until very soft they will come out perfect..the people in 1 star have no clue on how to cook or use this item..disregard them.
customer_reviews.author: Watchman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: awesome little unit. Cleans and stores all together, it stores in a small foot print. Because of the plastic unit, it will not rust. Clean in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.author: Jdw

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product material and functionality. It extracted almost every thing. Strongly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great potatoes, I also have the garlic press and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great potatoes, I also have the garlic press and love it. I bought potato peelers and I keep giving them away this company is great. Need more vegetable peelers
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Great potato ricer
customer_reviews.text: Great potato ricer and spaetzle maker. My daughter wanted this to make mashed potatoes. She loves it, says it's much better than the old potato masher, and I have to agree. I make spaetzles at our house, and this ricer makes the perfect German spaetzles, and makes them fast!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Christlieb

customer_reviews.title: Works great, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Hold's more potato pieces for ricing than most but is hard to take apart for cleaning, etc.. Even my husband can't budge the cover to change the plates. However, it makes great mashed potatoes and works easily and smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Prefered ricer for us
customer_reviews.text: I really like this ricer. A bit larger than expected tho, but convenient, The storage area for the discs makes this a vey nice gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: I love this ricer
customer_reviews.text: I love this ricer! It is easy to use and fairly easy to clean. I use it for potatoes, sweet potatoes, cauliflower.....love the texture of the "riced" veggie.....smooth and delicious! Would purchase this one again should I need another ricer!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Haslam

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, although the first time I used it I did not peel my potatoes so it kept jamming. But I know now that I need to peel potatoes, it made smooth creamy potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Best mashed potatoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: My kids hate lumpy mashed potatoes and I hate whipped ones. Tis make perfectly smooth mashed potatoes. Or cauliflower. Or whatever...
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for more. It saves time in a very efficient way. I was just a bit skeptical, but the price and other's comments convinced me to order. Very happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: juanita triplett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a dream! Would recommend to anyone for creamy mashed potatoes like you wouldn't believe.
customer_reviews.author: Gayla

customer_reviews.title: good and fast
customer_reviews.text: for the price this is a good ricer I really love it..makes potatoes creamy and no lumps clean ups easy too
customer_reviews.author: koko

customer_reviews.title: Potato ricer
customer_reviews.text: This potato ricer is an improvement over one I bought many moons ago. Its multiple discs are self-storing so they are less likely to get lost and it has a "lip" that allows the user to hang it on the edge of the bowl or pan affording greater leverage. That being said, it can be a little unwieldy and slips around the edge of the bowl at times. I paid almost twice what I had paid for my other one but it appears sturdy enough to last for a long time, so probably worth the investment. All-in-all a good product for turning out lump-free potatoes and vegetable "purees".
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations and created excellent mash potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought the unit to make mash potatoes the major ingredient in Lefsa. It worked as I expected and was big enough to put 1 large whole boiled potato or a couple of smaller ones. 1 squeeze on the handle and out popped perfect consistency mashed potatoes. The product arrived just as expected, so it met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: So many uses besides potatos
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and good working unit. You can also used to compress others items to reduce moisture... Like squeezing the liquid out of spinach for a stuffing...
customer_reviews.author: James T Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My mom loved it so much that I had to get her one too!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Tater Ricer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, sturdy thick plastic and stainless steel construction. Makes great hashbrowns the perfect size. Fairly easy to clean. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Wade-o-potato

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Came quick and works well. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: works great, kinda hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I like this and would not give it up for anything. One gripe though......it is molded plastic and there are areas where water can pile in the dishwasher, and it piles. Other than that if you want smooth potatoes, get it!
customer_reviews.author: randy pratt

customer_reviews.title: Kuhn Rikon Potato Ricer
customer_reviews.text: Kuhn Rikon Potato Ricer made in Switzerland is the best ricer I have ever owned. It comes with two ricer hole patterns one large and one smaller. It makes everything just the right size for all of my uses.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hasenbeck

customer_reviews.title: A tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kuhn Rikon Potato Ricer from what the good reviews said. I use to make lumpy mash potatoes, now it's a no brainer. Easy to use and easy to clean. And the price is not bad too. "It's a must have."
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Mash dem taters
customer_reviews.text: This object rices potatoes and other things very well. The second disk stores in the handle and the whole thing cleans up easily. I continue to find more and more uses for it. Get one for yourself and then you can play with food too.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, but it does work.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to be disappointed by this ricer. First off, it is plastic and doesn't feel solid. Plus, it is overly large & bulky (even accounting for what they claim is an over-sized bin). But lastly, the unit doesn't 100% rest of the bowl into which you're ricing - so one hand is always on the handle & it makes the process cumbersome. To it's credit, it does have a fold-out lip you can use to rest the front of the unit on the bowl; but - the handle has a strongly curved shape so you always end up holding that side of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Ruggles-Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: quality is good
customer_reviews.text: This unit requires the potatoes etc. to be in a soft condition. The cleaning of this unit for a small amount of mashing is excessive. A standard hand potatoe masher, which is very easy to clean is better for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Ghiz

customer_reviews.title: Stupid purchase
customer_reviews.text: stupid purchase. thought to use to make hash browns but can't use the item to remove water. it does a great job of making it into rice after I already boil or cook in microwave but honestly, a quick stir, the rice pieces just turn to mush. wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.author: Guesswho

product_meta.title: Kuhn Rikon Potato Ricer with 2 Stainless Disks, White
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteTop chefs agree only a ricer can produce the perfect texture for mashed potatoes and other root vegetables. In a single stroke, the Kuhn Rikon swiss-designed ricer gently extrudes long, light strands through either of two stainless steel disks. Use the disk with larger holes for a mashed side dish or the one with smaller holes to make a fine puree. Make blenderless sauces. Try it for berry sauces for desserts or for tomato puree. Make healthy, homemade baby food, strain blanched greens like spinach or chard. Make potato pancakes, gnocchi and spaetzel.
feature_bullets: Perfectly balances for easy rising with less effort
No lost disks, convenient storage for second disk built in
Screw on collar makes changing disks easy
1-1/2-cup extra-capacity hopper that holds one large or two medium-sized potatoes

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars202 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
